1: The Lord reigns. He is robed in majesty. The Lord is robed; he wears strength around his waist.[b] Indeed, the world is established; it cannot be moved.
2: Your throne has been secure from ancient times; you have always been king.[c]
3: The waves[d] roar, O Lord, the waves roar, the waves roar and crash.[e]
4: Above the sound of the surging water,[f] and the mighty waves of the sea, the Lord sits enthroned in majesty.[g]
5: The rules you set down[h] are completely reliable.[i] Holiness[j] aptly adorns your house, O Lord, forever.[k]
